channel.title: Home on xAIM
channel.description: Recent content in Home on xAIM

item.title: Orange Webinar for Educators
item.description: On Thursday, May 26, 2022, at 16:00 CET, partners at the University of Ljubljana will organize a webinar for educators who either use or are interested in using Orange Data Mining in data science training.

item.title: The Minister of Science of Lower Saxony visited L3S
item.description: The Minister of Science of Lower Saxony Björn Thümler visited L3S on 27 April 2022. The occasion is the AI theme week, which follows the publication of Lower Saxony’s AI strategy intended to help the topic of AI gain more attention.

item.title: Professor Roberto V. Zicari gave a Guest Lecture on Trustworthy AI at the Seoul National University Law School
item.description: Professor Roberto V. Zicari was invited to give a guest lecture by Professor Heo, Seongwook, Professor of Law at the Seoul National University Law School.

item.title: The next xAIM project meeting taking place at Keele University
item.description: The next xAIM project meeting, hosted by Professor Ian CUMMING - Professor of Global Healthcare Workforce and Strategy- will take place at Keele University, Newcastle (Staffordshire), on the 7th and 8th July 2022.

item.title: Upcoming project meeting in Hannover
item.description: The project members will meet again, live, in Hannover. The meeting will be hosted by our colleagues at L3S Research Center, and will take place on 25th and 26th of November, 2021.

item.title: On-site project meeting in Pavia
item.description: Project members met at University of Pavia from 22nd to 24th of September, 2021. This was the first on-site meeting of the project, with all key researchers and actors present at the meeting.

item.title: xAIM project approved!
item.description: The consortium led by the University of Pavia has won the call of the European Commission “Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) Telecom” designed to offer co-financing to stimulate and support the spread of European Digital Service Infrastructures (DSI) in various sectors, including the design and implementation of specialized master’s programs in Artificial Intelligence (AI).

item.title: Admission Requirements
item.description: Since the Master Programme is completely taught in English, fluency is required (e.g. B2 Level). You can apply for the xAIM Master if you hold at least one of the following degrees:

item.title: Application Procedure and Form
item.description: The call for applications is already open! We’re delighted to learn that you’re interested in applying for this program. The maximum number of students who can enroll in this master program for each year is 35.

item.title: Call for Applications
item.description: Call for admission (with instructions on how to apply, the version in Italian language here) Appending to the Call with additional information (the version in Italian language here)

item.title: Evaluation and Selection
item.description: A special Commission deals with the procedure for evaluating and selecting candidates, this procedure is divided into two phases: Evaluation of qualifications and skills of candidates according to the Evaluation Criteria listed below, for a maximum score of 50/100.

item.title: Questionnaire
item.description: Are you considering applying to the xAIM Master? Please fill in our preliminary questionnaire: we would like to know more about you and your interests.

item.title: Registration
item.description: The call for applications is now open! Before starting the application, read carefully the registration guide. Prospective students can apply by You can apply by October 31th.

item.title: Registration Guide
item.description: Step 1: Preread Please make sure that you read the Call for applications before you register for the Master’s program. The call is already available.
